e15190.neutron_wall.spectra.Cuts¶

class e15190.neutron_wall.spectra.Cuts¶

A class of default cuts for neutron wall spectra.

This class only offers the typical cuts that are being applied. If you want to change the cuts by a lot, it might be easier to simply write your own strings.

Functions

__init__()

edge([left, right, on])

Cut for the two edges of a neutron wall bar.

psd([psd_low, psd_upp, perp_low, perp_upp, on])

Cut for pulse shape discrimination.

shadow_bars([on])

Cut for the regions on the neutron wall that are shadowed.
__init__()¶
static edge(left=- 80, right=89, on='NWB')¶

Cut for the two edges of a neutron wall bar.

This cut is used to remove the ambiguity near the edges of the bar.

Parameters

  • left (float, default e15190.neutron_wall.geometry.Bar.edges_x[0]) – The left edge of the bar in cm.

  • right (float, default e15190.neutron_wall.geometry.Bar.edges_x[1]) – The right edge of the bar in cm.

static shadow_bars(on='NWB')¶

Cut for the regions on the neutron wall that are shadowed.

We remove the segments -50 < x < -15 and 15 < x < 50 for NWB bars 7, 8, 9, 15, 16, 17.

static psd(psd_low=0.5, psd_upp=4.0, perp_low=- 0.7, perp_upp=0.7, on='NWB')¶

Cut for pulse shape discrimination.

We used two-dimensional pulse shape discrimination (PSD). The first dimension or axis accounts for most of the separation, while the second dimension is perpendicular to the first one.

This cut only makes sense after vetoing the charged particles.

Parameters

  • psd_low (float, default 0.5) – The lower bound of the cut. By default, it is 0.5 - data above 0.5 are accepted as neutrons, whereas data below 0.5 are rejected as gammas.

  • psd_upp (float, default 4.0) – The upper bound of the cut, to make sure no extreme outliers are included.

  • perp_low (float, default -0.7) – The lower bound of the perpendicular axis.

  • perp_upp (float, default 0.7) – The upper bound of the perpendicular axis.
